The whole east side of the stream runs along the side of a cup block with 30-50m of buffer zone.

In frequent pools available for holding primarily on outside bends and behind large Woody Dupree. Some evidence of anthropogenic manipulation of the stream channel with saw removing Cottonwood that had fallen in and was standing the channel. Generally, Ryan is in great shape, mature shrub communities throughout and some old growth Cottonwood that should provide complexity into the future into the stream.

Culvert appears to have potentially been worked on in the past to attempt to backwater boulder lines are present downstream. Large amount of rain over there previous evening as well as the couple weeks before, so have risen to moderate levels with conditions, major tributary to the Chacko river with known Schnuck presents in the past. "," Medium value habitat. Stream has been heavily impacted by cattle throughout entire area surveyed with evidence of bank, tramping and extensive Eugen low grate muddy areas. Stream is primarily dry for the first 300 m upstream of the culvert with young forest and shrubs. Then intermittent pools begin associated with beaver activity. At approximately 450 or 500 m upstream becomes almost entirely watered with pools up to 40 cm deep. Many areas surveyed appear to be wetland type with spirea, willow older and trembling aspen throughout. "
